text: I know the documentation says java 8 or later, but it looks like there might be a version issue with one of the local server’s dependencies. Your best bet for the time being might be to try running with java 8, rather than 11
Thanks for the reply. I tried to uninstall java 11. I followed the documentation but typing Java —version, still showed me 11. Will try it again today.
i know this is silly and i am slow on the adoption, but i just started using the terminal in vscode...changing my life
I still need to switch to that, still waiting on getting a new comp first
and yea the terminal is how I deal with complicated git issues that the gui just isn’t meant for
I just started using VS Code. So far Im happy.
like `code .` to open the current folder
if i can get a tv in this thing, i may never leave
The best feature I’ve discovered has been the ability to explore a mongodb as I’m troubleshooting through the cosmosdb plugin

So many great shortcuts in vscode. Shift+alt+up or down to copy and paste a code block, and there was something extra I had to do to set up it but now I can highlight a section and hit alt+w to wrap tags around it, with any shortcut you want to throw at it (so a div with class “container” would just be `.container`)
